text: Royal Medical Society (RMS) is the oldest medical society in the United Kingdom.Manuel, Diana E. Marshall Hall (1790-1857): Science and Medicine in Early Victorian Society, p. 9. The RMS is a British professional society engaged in the moving forward of medical knowledge. ==History== It was called "the Medical Society" when it was established in 1737. The Society was granted a Royal Charter in 1778. RMS is based in Edinburgh, Scotland. The society has members throughout the world. ==Notable members== :This list is not finished; you can help Wikipedia by adding to it. *Charles Darwin *Benjamin Franklin *Joseph Lister ==Related pages == * List of Royal Societies ==References== ==Other websites== *RMS website Category:1737 establishments Medical Category:18th-century establishments in Great Britain Category:1730s establishments in Europe
title: Royal Medical Society
